text: Thank you so much for entering our competition. Jamie and I were really excited to get so many
pictures through.
We've had thousands on Instagram, loads of emails, we have to narrow it down.

You know we've tried to look at
everything, we've looked at the lighting,
we've looked at the composition and ultimately taste-ability of the food. It's a gut
reaction for me, you sort of look at it and think
wow I want to eat that.

We've got three to talk about now
and we're going to try and talk about three
each time. The first one I want to show you is by someone called Alessandra and I mean she's got it
completely, the framing is lovely, the lighting's lovely. It's got a wonderful style

to it. The background, I don't know what
she's chosen, it looks like she's flipped
over a tray or something. The background is beautiful.
i mean here we have some little cabbage parcels. Who knows what's
inside the parcels of cabbage but what's nice about this photo is i want to know
what's inside the parcels of cabbage.
So yeah, Alessandra, great.
Lovely photo, love it.
Next one which we've shortlisted is by someone called Jonathan. Amazing
Jonathan. Again the lighting on this is lovely. I love the use of the
darkness.
With food photography you are thinking about light and brightness and
everything and
food photographers always have this fear
of darkness.

But actually this one's used darkness
to such a good
way, what you instantly feel with this photo I think is you want to pick that first
one up and dunk it into the jam. It's all the little textures and again the focus is perfect.
You know the focus is across the first one
with the polenta flour and then into the polenta flour
and then
you know the focus on the jam. There's nothing soft that shouldn't be soft.
Yeah it's a good photo. Nice one Jonathan.
Now the next photo we've shortlisted is this one. There was a tendency

sometimes for people to go far too
close to food and that could
sometimes make things look
too abstract in a way.

But thereis something about this one, I mean
it's very, very close.
The colours are amazing i mean it really

you know, it really pings out of the screen. The
focus is perfect. It's right on that little crack of the egg

and again it has great food appeal,
i want to eat this, I want... it's
hot, it's ready, it's instant.
and it's a great photo.

So I'm really sorry I have to narrow it
down to one out of
the three. Its really hard
but I have to do it
and I have to say, the one I'm going to go for is Jonathan,
with his muffins and his raspberry jam.
I just think that one has
the sort of ultimate taste appeal really. I do want to dunk that muffin in that jam.
Well done Jonathan.
